meanings.definition: A type of metamorphic rock that has a foliated structure.
meanings.sent1: The geologist found a piece of schist during the rock study.
meanings.sent2: The schist in the mountain showed distinct layering.
meanings.sent3: The schist seemed to be smiling at the other rocks around.
meanings.sent4: The layers of schist told a story of ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The schist sparkled in the sunlight, revealing its unique pattern.

meanings.definition: To split or break into thin layers.
meanings.sent1: She used a hammer to schist the large rock into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent2: The old building began to schist due to years of neglect.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to schist the vegetables for a fancy presentation.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to schist into a million pieces after the breakup.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully schisted the clay to create intricate designs.
